intro: Melandrium jugorum, commonly known as the common catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its fruits are dry capsules that release seeds when mature. Melandrium jugorum is also known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its tolerance to drought conditions.
